bibl.title: Letter from William E. Deeks to Henry Rose Carter, October 29, 1924

div1.p: Deeks writes that he expects to attend the meeting of the National Malaria Committee and make a presentation.

div1.head: Letter from William E. Deeks to Henry Rose Carter, October 29, 1924
div1.opener:
mis
Deeks
6000-3-23
N.Y. 24
UNITED FRUIT COMPANY
GENERAL OFFICES, 131 STATE STREET, BOSTON, MASS.
MEDICAL DEPARTMENT
17 BATTERY PLACE, NEW YORK
October 29th, 1924
WILLIAM E. DEEKS, M. D.
GENERAL MANAGER
CABLE ADDRESS
UNIFRUITCO, NEW YORK
FILE NO.____
Dr. H. R. Carter,
2122 California Street, N.W.,
Washington, D. C.
Dear Doctor Carter:
div1.p:
I am very much interested in your letter of October 28th
with the enclosure from General Stitt, which I am returning herewith.
Needless to say I appreciate very much your effort to be of any as-
sistance to us in our work, and any practical constructive sugges-
tions are of great value to us.

I expect to be in New Orleans next month to attend the
meeting of the National Malaria Committee. I have also been asked
to address the Presidents, Secretaries, and Health Officers of the
Southern states, and have selected as the basis of my talk “Conclu-
sions Relating to the Treatment of Malaria Based on Recent Research
Work.”

I expect to meet a number of men there who are doing prac-
tical constructive work, and am sure I will obtain some new ideas.
I hope sincerely you will be able to be present as by this time you
are quite accustomed to travel.

I do not suppose the enclosed pamphlet is of any interest
to you, but I am sending it notwithstanding.
With kind regards to you and Miss Carter,
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, W E Deeks
General Manager WED/KD
